conclusion: The refractive index of the material is \( n = 2 \), the point source of light is at point \( O \), the arc \( AC \) has radius \( R \), and the square \( ABCO \) is formed by the intersection of the arc \( AC \) with the cylinder.

The diagram shows a square \( ABCO \) with \( O \) at the bottom-left corner, \( A \) at the top-left corner, \( B \) at the top-right corner, and \( C \) at the bottom-right corner. The arc \( AC \) forms a quarter-circle with center \( O \) and radius \( R \).
The refractive index \( n = 2 \) means that light travels at twice the speed in the material compared to in a vacuum.
The light source is at point \( O \), and the light travels towards the arc \( AC \).
The light cannot directly exit through \( AB \) or \( BC \) because the refractive index is greater than 1.
The light travels from point \( O \) to point \( E \) on the arc \( AC \).
The distance from \( O \) to \( E \) is \( \frac{R}{2} \) because \( E \) is the midpoint of the arc \( AC \).
The light then travels from point \( E \) to point \( F \) on the arc \( AB \).
The distance from \( E \) to \( F \) is \( \frac{R}{2} \) because \( F \) is the midpoint of the arc \( AB \).
The light then travels from point \( F \) to point \( G \) on the arc \( BC \).
The distance from \( F \) to \( G \) is \( \frac{R}{2} \) because \( G \) is the midpoint of the arc \( BC \).
The total length of the arc \( AC \) is \( 2R \).
The total length of the arc \( AB \) is \( 2R \).
The total length of the arc \( BC \) is \( 2R \).
The total length of the arc \( AC \), \( AB \), and \( BC \) is \( 2R \).
The length of the arc where the lights are incident is \( 2R \).
